section.p: An offshore wind brings the scent of strange blossoms, dead vegetation and the stink of malarial swamps.
‘The Weeping Jungle,’ declares the mate gloomily. ‘My brother lost his life in that pest-infested wilderness.’
The quartermaster expresses a sceptical view: ‘I heard your brother died in a tavern brawl in Ringhorn.’
‘Bah!’ The mate stamps off to his cabin. You begin to worry about the crew’s morale. .
